Package com.github.oeuvres.alix.util

Class IntRoller

java.lang.Object
com.github.oeuvres.alix.util.Roller
com.github.oeuvres.alix.util.IntRoller
public class IntRoller extends Roller
An efficient rolling array of int without creation of elements.

      protected final int[] data
      Fixed size data array.

  • Constructor Details

    • IntRoller

      public IntRoller(int capacity)
      Create a roller with a fixed number of positions.
      Parameters:
      capacity - number of positions

  • Method Details

    • add

      public boolean add(int value)
      Add a value to roller. Contract similar to Collection.add(E).
      Parameters:
      value - to append to head.
      Returns:
      always true.

    • fill

      public void fill(int value)
      Fill roller with an initial value
      Parameters:
      value - to set at all positions

    • get

      public int get(int position)
      Retrieves a value at a position. Contract similar to List.get(int), but without exceptions, because all positions are accepted, even negative; will roll around array if out of the limits.
      Parameters:
      position - position of the value to replace
      Returns:
      the value at the specified position

    • remove

      public int remove() throws NoSuchElementException
      Retrieves and removes the head of this roller. Throws an exception if this roller is empty. Contract similar to Queue.remove().
      Returns:
      last added element
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if collection is empty.

    • set

      public int set(int position, int value)
      Replaces the value at the specified position with the specified value. Contract similar to List.set(int,java.lang.Object), but without exceptions, because all positions are accepted, even negative; will roll around array if out of the limits.
      Parameters:
      position - position of the value to replace
      value - value to be stored at the specified position
      Returns:
      the value previously at the specified position

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
